ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: by the Lote-tree of the Final Limit,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: By the Lote-tree beyond which none can pass,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: by the lote-tree at the farthest boundary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: to the Lot-tree (in the seven heavens)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Near the lote-tree of the last boundary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: by the Lote-Tree of the Boundary
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: by the lote tree beyond which none may pass
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nigh Unto the lote-tree at the boundary.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: by the Lote Tree of the Ultimate Boundary,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Near the Lote-tree beyond which none may pass:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Near Sidrat-ul-Muntaha [lote-tree of the utmost boundary (beyond which none can pass)],
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: at the Lote Tree (Sidrat tree) of the ending
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: At the Lotus Tree of the Extremity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: At the Lote Tree of the Utmost Boundary -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [53:14] by the Lote-tree of the Ultimate Boundary, when he was carried on the night journey [up] through the heavens — this [lote-tree] is a nabk thorn-tree [that lies] to the right of the Throne (‘arsh), [the tree] beyond which no angel or any other being pass;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (By the lote tree of the utmost boundary) at which point every close angel and sent prophet stops; it is also said that this means: the knowledge of every close angel and sent prophet and firm-footed scholar stops at this point,
